page.title: 18THE FIELD STUDY CENTRE
page.content: The Field Study Centre is in a designated industrial area. It is not a National Reserve but an Educational Nature Reserve. The CEGB own the land.It was opened in 1973, 10 acres,5 of water with one laboratory. Now in 1985 it covers 20 acres, has 2 labs., 2 toilets, a storeroom, office and display room. Kent schools visit, 5 yrs. to 6th.Form,9 to 10 thousand children a year. They study Natural History,fresh water life,birds,plants and insects. There is 1 warden who assists visitors,helps plan lessons, maintains the apparatus,and the Reserve itself.Volunteers help. 99 different species of bird have been recorded. The lake water has prolific life, and can be compared with the running water of the River Stour which forms one boundary..
